Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Forward \For"ward\, v. t. [imp. & p. p. {Forwarded}; p. pr. & vb. n. {Forwarding}.] 1. To help onward; to advance; to promote; to accelerate; to quicken; to hasten; as, to forward the growth of a plant; to forward one in improvement. [1913 Webster]
2. To send forward; to send toward the place of destination; to transmit; as, to forward a letter. [1913 Webster]

Dictionary.Name: The Collaborative International Dictionary of English v.0.44

Definition.WordDefinition:
Forwarding \For"ward*ing\, n. 1. The act of one who forwards; the act or occupation of transmitting merchandise or other property for others. [1913 Webster]
2. (Bookbinding) The process of putting a book into its cover, and making it ready for the finisher. [1913 Webster]

forwarding n 1: the act of sending on to another destination; "the forwarding of mail to a new address is done automatically"; "the forwarding of resumes to the personnel department" 2: the advancement of some enterprise; "his experience in marketing resulted in the forwarding of his career" [syn: {furtherance}, {promotion}]
